Player History
Hit first career homerun on 5/5/1965, off Bill Monbouquette (DET)...
Was selected to the 1965 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1965...
Was selected to the 1966 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1966, hitting .500 with 2 HR, 13 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/1966, hitting .344 with 6 HR, 31 RBI...
Was selected to the 1968 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Boston in 1968...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Cleveland on 5/22/1970...
Injured on 7/24/1970 with a Tender Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Series with Boston in 1970...
Signed as a free agent by Philadelphia on 2/1/1972 to a 2-year deal worth $4,996,541 per year...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1972...
Signed as a free agent by Texas on 2/25/1974 to a 2-year deal worth $2,125,000 per year...
